text: The Savoureuse is a river in eastern France; it is the principal river running through the Territoire de Belfort. ==Geography== The Savoureuse has a length of , and a drainage basin with an area of approximately . Its average yearly discharge (volume of water which passes through a section of the river per unit of time) has been measured in three places: # Giromagny (1974 - 2017), at an altitude of , with a discharge of ; # Belfort (1965 - 2017), at an altitude of , with a discharge of ; and # Vieux-Charmont (1986 - 2017), at an altitude of , with a discharge of ; ===Course=== The Savoureuse starts on the Ballon d'Alsace, southern Vosges Mountains, in the commune of Lepuix, Territoire de Belfort department, at an elevation of about . It flows from north to south through the Territoire de Belfort department. At Nommay, the river gets into the Doubs department where it joins, in the commune of Étupes near the city of Sochaux, the Allaine river, a tributary of the Doubs river at about of altitude.
